page.title: 12Princetown Church
page.content: Princetown Church, St. Michael's and All Angels,is interesting because of its connections with the nearby prison. It was built by French and American prisoners of war between 1810-1814, during the Napoleonic Wars. In the church is a beautiful stained- glass window and at the bottom is some writing which says: 'To the Glory of God and in memory of the American prisoners of war who were detained in the Dartmoor war prison between the years 1813 and 1815 and who helped to build this church, especially of the 218 brave men who died here on behalf of their country, this window is presented by the National Society United States Daughters of 1812.' There are three flags in the church, too. One is the English flag, one is French and the other is American.
